Sure! If you only have time for three, I would recommend the following:

1. Castello di Amorosa: It's a unique and memorable experience, with the castle-like architecture, medieval-inspired decor, and delicious wines. They offer multiple tasting options, as well as guided tours, so there's something for everyone.

2. Robert Sinskey Vineyards: This winery has a sustainable and organic approach to winemaking, which is becoming increasingly popular in the Napa Valley. They also have a culinary garden and offer food and wine pairings, making it a great spot for foodies.

3. Sterling Vineyards: This vineyard has a scenic aerial tram ride that takes you above the valley and offers stunning views. The winery also features an impressive art collection, which sets it apart from other vineyards in the area. 

These three wineries offer a unique experience that you won't find at every vineyard, making them stand out among the many amazing options in Napa Valley.
